title: torch.cpu — PyTorch 2.9 documentation
text:
## torch.cpu#

Created On: Jul 11, 2023 | Last Updated On: Oct 11, 2023
This package implements abstractions found intorch.cudato facilitate writing device-agnostic code.
torch.cuda
current_device

current_device
Returns current device for cpu.
current_stream

current_stream
Returns the currently selectedStreamfor a given device.
Stream
is_available

is_available
Returns a bool indicating if CPU is currently available.
synchronize

synchronize
Waits for all kernels in all streams on the CPU device to complete.
stream

stream
Wrapper around the Context-manager StreamContext that selects a given stream.
set_device

set_device
Sets the current device, in CPU we do nothing.
device_count

device_count
Returns number of CPU devices (not cores).
StreamContext

StreamContext
Context-manager that selects a given stream.

## Streams and events#

Stream

Stream
